mahabharata_genealogy.name: King Shantanu
mahabharata_genealogy.description: King of Hastinapura, ancestor of the Pandavas and Kauravas.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Ganga
mahabharata_genealogy.description: River goddess, the first wife of Shantanu.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Bhishma
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Son of Shantanu and Ganga. He took a vow of celibacy and served as the grandsire and protector of Hastinapura. He was killed by Arjuna, with Shikhandi providing the crucial intervention.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Satyavati
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A fisherwoman who became Shantanu's second wife. She was the grandmother of Dhritarashtra and Pandu.

relationships.notes: Had a son, Vyasa, before her marriage to Shantanu.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Parashara
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A powerful sage who fathered Vyasa with Satyavati.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Vyasa
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The sage who authored the Mah훮bh훮rata. He fathered Dhritarashtra, Pandu, and Vidura through the practice of niyoga to continue the Kuru lineage.

relationships.notes: Conceived with an unnamed maid via niyoga.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Chitrangada
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The elder son of Shantanu and Satyavati, killed at a young age.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Vichitravirya
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The younger son of Shantanu and Satyavati. He died childless.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Ambika
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Wife of Vichitravirya. She became the mother of Dhritarashtra through niyoga with Vyasa.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Ambalika
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Wife of Vichitravirya. She became the mother of Pandu through niyoga with Vyasa.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: King Pandu
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The legal father of the Pandavas and King of Hastinapura. He was cursed to die upon physical intimacy.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Kunti
mahabharata_genealogy.description: First wife of Pandu. Using a divine boon, she invoked various gods to bear sons.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Arjuna
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The third Pandava, a master archer and central hero of the Mah훮bh훮rata.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Karna
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The firstborn son of Kunti and the sun god Surya. Raised by a charioteer, he became a loyal friend to Duryodhana and a key warrior for the Kaurava side.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Dhritarashtra
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The blind king of Hastinapura and father of the Kauravas.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Gandhari
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Wife of Dhritarashtra and mother of the 100 Kauravas. She blindfolded herself for life to share her husband's blindness.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Duryodhana
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The eldest of the 100 Kaurava brothers and the primary antagonist to the Pandavas.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Dushasana
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The second Kaurava brother, infamous for attempting to disrobe Draupadi.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Dushala
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The only daughter of Dhritarashtra and Gandhari.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Jayadratha
mahabharata_genealogy.description: King of Sindhu and husband of Dushala. He played a key role in trapping and killing Abhimanyu.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Vidura
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The wise prime minister of Hastinapura, half-brother to Dhritarashtra and Pandu.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Krishna
mahabharata_genealogy.description: An incarnation of Vishnu, cousin to the Pandavas, and Arjuna's charioteer and guide.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Balarama
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Krishna's elder brother. He taught mace fighting to both Bhima and Duryodhana and remained neutral in the war.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Satyaki
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A powerful Vrishni warrior and a devoted disciple of Arjuna who fought for the Pandavas.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Drupada
mahabharata_genealogy.description: King of Panchala and a staunch ally of the Pandavas.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Draupadi
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Daughter of Drupada, born from a sacrificial fire. She was the common wife of the five Pandava brothers.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Dhrishtadyumna
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Brother of Draupadi and commander-in-chief of the Pandava army. He was destined to kill Drona.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Shikhandi
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Child of Drupada, born female as Amba in a previous life. Played a crucial role in the death of Bhishma.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Abhimanyu
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The valiant son of Arjuna and Subhadra. He was tragically killed in the war after being trapped in the Chakravyuha formation.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Subhadra
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Sister of Krishna and Balarama, and wife of Arjuna.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Uttara (Princess)
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Princess of the Matsya Kingdom, daughter of King Virata, and wife of Abhimanyu.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Ghatotkacha
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The powerful half-rakshasa son of Bhima and Hidimbi.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Hidimbi
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A Rakshasi who fell in love with Bhima and married him.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Virata
mahabharata_genealogy.description: King of the Matsya Kingdom, who gave shelter to the Pandavas during their year of incognito exile.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Shakuni
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The maternal uncle of the Kauravas and the master manipulator behind the infamous dice game.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Bhagadatta
mahabharata_genealogy.description: King of Pragjyotisha, an ancient warrior known for his skilled elephant army.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Kritavarma
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A Vrishni warrior who, despite being from Krishna's clan, chose to fight for the Kauravas.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Ashwatthama
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Son of Dronacharya. He is one of the few survivors of the Kurukshetra War and was cursed with immortality.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Dronacharya
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The royal teacher of both the Pandavas and Kauravas. He fought for the Kauravas due to his allegiance to Hastinapura.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Kripacharya
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The royal preceptor of the Kuru princes. He is an immortal and fought for the Kauravas.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Alambusha
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A Rakshasa warrior and brother of Baka, who fought for the Kauravas to avenge his brother's death.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Shalya
mahabharata_genealogy.description: King of Madra and the maternal uncle of Nakula and Sahadeva. He was tricked into fighting for the Kauravas and served as Karna's charioteer.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Bhurishravas
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A prince of the Bahlika Kingdom and a powerful Kaurava ally.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Yuyutsu
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A son of Dhritarashtra through a Vaishya maid. He recognized the injustice of the Kauravas and defected to the Pandava side before the war.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Yudhishthira
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The eldest Pandava, son of Kunti and the god Dharma. Known for his righteousness and piety.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Bhima
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The second Pandava, son of Kunti and the wind god Vayu. Known for his immense strength.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Nakula
mahabharata_genealogy.description: One of the twin sons of Madri and the divine Ashwini Kumars. Known for his handsomeness and skill with horses.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Sahadeva
mahabharata_genealogy.description: One of the twin sons of Madri and the divine Ashwini Kumars. Known for his wisdom and knowledge of astrology.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Adhiratha
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A charioteer in the service of Hastinapura who found and raised Karna.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Radha
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Wife of Adhiratha and the adoptive mother of Karna.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Unnamed maid
mahabharata_genealogy.description: An attendant of Ambika who became the mother of Vidura through niyoga with Vyasa.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Yama
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The god of righteousness and justice, spiritual father of Yudhishthira.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Vayu
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The god of the wind, spiritual father of Bhima.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Surya
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The sun god, spiritual father of Karna.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Ashwini Kumars
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Divine twin horsemen and physicians to the gods, spiritual fathers of Nakula and Sahadeva.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Rukmi
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Brother of Rukmini (Krishna's wife). He remained neutral in the war, having been rejected by both sides.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Ekalavya
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A Nishada prince and a highly skilled archer who sacrificed his thumb as guru dakshina to Drona.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Vrihadvala
mahabharata_genealogy.description: King of Kosala, who fought and died on the Kaurava side.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Paundraka Vasudeva
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A king who falsely claimed to be the real Vasudeva (Krishna) and was slain by him before the war.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Narada
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A celestial sage known for traveling to different worlds and providing counsel and information.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Markandeya
mahabharata_genealogy.description: An ancient sage who advised the Pandavas during their exile by telling them stories of dharma.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Vasishtha
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A revered ancient sage who appears in ancestral stories.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Sanjaya
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The charioteer and minister of King Dhritarashtra. He was granted divine sight by Vyasa to narrate the events of the Kurukshetra War to the blind king.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Indra
mahabharata_genealogy.description: King of the Devas (gods) and the spiritual father of Arjuna.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Varuna
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The god of water, who provided divine weapons.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Agni
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The god of fire, who helped Arjuna burn the Khandava Forest and granted him the Gandiva bow.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Takshaka
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A king of the Nagas (serpents) who was an enemy of Arjuna and later killed his grandson, Parikshit.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Vasuki
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A king of the Nagas.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Baka
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A Rakshasa who terrorized the village of Ekachakra and was killed by Bhima.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Parikshit
mahabharata_genealogy.description: The posthumous son of Abhimanyu and Uttara. He succeeded Yudhishthira as the King of Hastinapura.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Somadatta
mahabharata_genealogy.description: King of the Bahlikas and father of Bhurishravas.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Vikarna
mahabharata_genealogy.description: A Kaurava brother known for his sense of justice, who protested against the humiliation of Draupadi.

mahabharata_genealogy.name: Madri
mahabharata_genealogy.description: Second wife of Pandu and mother of the twins Nakula and Sahadeva.
